website_summaries.verdict: The unrivaled sturdiness and high capacity of this external hard drive makes it the best model for travelers.
pros: Resists dust, rain, and up to 1,000 lbs of pressure
cons: The extreme durability of this hard drive drives up its price

customer_reviews.title: Died in Two Months
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because G-Drives have a good reputation. I purchased the rugged version just in case I dropped it. Well, I did not drop it. Not once. It has never been airborne. When it stopped connecting to my MAC, I took it to a local computer shop. They tried it on three separate computers. It would not connect with one of them. The power light lights on the drive, but no computer recognizes the drive. It is past Amazon's return date. The guy at the shop said he trusts Western Digital, but that does me no good now. I have figure out if I can send it back anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey D

customer_reviews.title: DIED after a couple months - no damage or drops!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one and liked it, so I purchased 2 more. After only a few months of owning the first one, It DIED. Won’t load! I contacted customer support and they sent me a link to software that costs $120 so I can try to retrieve my data. I told them I was shocked that was their answer since this drive is basically brand new (no drops or damage or anything besides normal use). They said they could only help me format it and if ai wanted my data back, that was their best option. I paid extra for these drives, expecting them to work well for years. Very, very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Jennay

customer_reviews.title: Sexy External Hard-Drive!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent external hard-drive in every way possible from design, durability, speed, and affordability!
customer_reviews.author: Marshawn

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: I placed 500 gig on it at one time and it did just fine. Although it did get pretty warm to the touch, but not hot. I can see where transferring a lot of data all the time could eventually cause a problem for some like they report. I don't know if it's the heat or not but the longer I have I will do an update. Even with the USB adapter on the lightening cable it was fast, a lot faster then my spin drive.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Walls

customer_reviews.title: Keeps blanking out
customer_reviews.text: I've had the drive less than a month, and it just randomly vanishes from my desktop. Just now (which makes me type this review) I'm transferring my data off this drive and either returning it or throwing it away. As we all know it's a nightmare to have drives that ghost out while in use. I've lost too many important files in the past to ignore these warning signs. Drive looks and feels awesome tho.
customer_reviews.author: Treagen

customer_reviews.title: Convenient
customer_reviews.text: This HD is pretty light. It’s pretty fast as well. I know it says durable but I rather not put it to the test. I use it on my 2019 Macbook Pro and I love the fact that it comes with a USB C cable and an adapter to USB A/B. I also get USB 3.1 speeds so that’s a plus. I definitely recommend this if you just need a backup or don’t want anything super slow. It’s not super fast but it seems like it can take a few drops and still keep working and the speed isn’t super fast but definitely not super slow.
customer_reviews.author: EAJ

customer_reviews.title: Had a problem re mounting after ejecting
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with this product and I’ll tell you why. I bought this for my BF and he says that it is so far unreliable, meaning it’s crashed on him 3 times and almost lost all his footage, it would not mount after ejecting even though he ran diagnostics on it within his Mac . Amazon just sent him a replacement hard drive and he will transfer all of his footage to the new one with hopes of a better experience. I will update this review based on the outcome. FYI he has had it for only a month and so has had this problem occur 3 times already.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay J.

customer_reviews.title: Not a Thunderbolt 3 drive but USB-C 3.1 Gen 1
customer_reviews.text: Although a nice drive that I got at a really good price I thought I was buying a Thunderbolt 3 drive. I should have read everything much closer. It's not even a Gen 2 port so it's max is 5 Gbps, half of a Gen 2 port and an 1/8 the speed of Thunderbolt 3. My bad. It's a good and solid drive. I like it. Although I haven't had it a long time it does come with a three year warranty. As a USB-C drive its a good drive.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Good drive but somewhat Unreliable.
customer_reviews.text: Needed a sturdy drive with a lot of space and in these front this drive succeeded. It’s very fast once connected and transfers are quick. My only issue with it is that sometimes it takes a while for the computer to recognize it. It’s happened a lot and it can be a bit frustrating. Tried it on a couple of my computers and it happened on all of them (MAC and Windows). Don’t really know what it is but just something to look out for. Other than that, great option!
customer_reviews.author: Ariel Baez

customer_reviews.title: Built like a tank
customer_reviews.text: It is a hard drive not an SSD so I knew it would be heavier. The case is really nice. Very thick rubber all the way around and aluminum case. The rubber plug to keep dirt and water out od the port seems to seal well. I have not dropped it drowned it, or run over it with my truck so I can't say if it does all it advertises, but appears that it would be close. Great price for 5Tb. I got it on sale, seem reasonably fast on my USB-C port. I really like this one as I have killed cases on previous HDDs and had to put them in new cases.
customer_reviews.author: Coosa

customer_reviews.title: Better cables please.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 of these drives for a documentary film project. I used them for redundancy in the field. Everything worked fine with my laptop but when I plugged them into my iMac Pro they were not recognizable. I needed to buy better cables. I buy lots of G Technology drives, the cable thing surprises me.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Z.

customer_reviews.title: Fast and it works
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the fastest drives we have used. We bought four of them, G-Tech and LaCie are the go to portable drives at CoolToysTV and ArtSurf Productions. We store each documentary on one of these drives in addition to a copy on the NAS server which just recently saved our butt when the NAS drive updated and decided to transcode h.365 video from our new 4K cameras and then corrupted all the files.
customer_reviews.author: Scott J Bourquin

customer_reviews.title: Good for a 1 tb worth compared to others
customer_reviews.text: Is reliable and does transfer pretty fast (was able to transfer about 62 gb from laptop to device in about 10 mins) , but not as fast as some others out there (transfer speed seemed to cap out at 130 MB/s) that may or may not cost more money. It reads well on my laptop and I would recommend. For those who want to travel with or just don't like how bulky it is you are able to take off the protective rubber/"armor". It also doesnt seem to heat up as much as my other 1 tb hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Andrade

customer_reviews.title: Is NOT really a Thunderbolt 3 ready device  : ( , also Die today
customer_reviews.text: Junk...drive just stopped working today, I can hear it spinning but have a click...click sound like the old drives use to make when they die, WIN10 detect it but can open or format it, I have only games installed on it and die during FROSTPUNK game : ( , now I have to buy another, wait weeks for it and re install all my games back...hate this thing, I'll never buy this brand again
customer_reviews.author: Osvaldo J

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with thunderbolt
customer_reviews.text: Works really well. Whisper quiet. Does not get hot. Computer shows you have a full 5tb. The cables that with it DO NOT fit into an thunderbolt port on 2013 iMac or MacBook Air. I thought it was thunderbolt but I don’t think it is. This is USBC and USB 3. That’s it.
customer_reviews.author: Yoli P.

customer_reviews.title: Will not eject. Slow.
customer_reviews.text: I'm worried about the day when this drive gives up from so many force ejects. The drive is too slow to work on images or video from. Would not recommend. This is my second G-Tech drive. The first was fantastic. This is so bad that I may never buy another.
customer_reviews.author: ttugeorocker

customer_reviews.title: Not to fast and it's shockprof.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how long this drive will last, but I like how the rubber protection sticks to anything and it will not slip from the table or my computer.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan M

customer_reviews.title: Crashed after a month
customer_reviews.text: Avoid this drive like the plague. It crashed shortly after using it after an upgrade to Mac OS Catalina. I lost a month’s worth of work. I wouldn’t use it for a doorstop at this point.m although I might for target practice.
customer_reviews.author: jim gunn

customer_reviews.title: Bad useless cable
customer_reviews.text: The drive is great it is exactly what I wanted and it's solid and rugged, but the cable supplied doesn't fit so luckily I have other USB C cables for other devices which do fit and do work. It would get 5 stars if the product came fully functional but sadly it's been supplied with a defective unusable cable hence the 3
customer_reviews.author: Tim Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Purchased 5TB drive, received 2TB. BEWARE!!!
customer_reviews.text: Received wrong size drive, says 2TB on the box, never opened it, returned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Prime Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. It was easy to set up for my Mac, and copying (I use this as a backup for a backup) was fast. The only problem I had was trying to register the product for warranty. The customer service for this company were fast and friendly. I feel confident that I can call on them again if I have a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Swsie

customer_reviews.title: High capacity in a small size
customer_reviews.text: Yes it has a high capacity in a small size. But it has a enough protective bumper to withstand a long fall onto a hard surface. The metal finish is really cool and almost glows in dim light. The biggest feature for me is the USB-C connector which is very easy to use. the connector is also protected by a silicone cover that’s very easy to put on and off.
customer_reviews.author: J. H. Goldman

customer_reviews.title: Robust and beautiful
customer_reviews.text: The drive feels robust and trendy looking. The speed is mentioned as 135 Mbps. but it gives me somewhere between 20Mbps and 106 Mbps. while transferring from USBC to USB3.1. While the speed test apps like BlackMagicDesign and AJA shows 106 Mbps read write speed.
customer_reviews.author: Uttam

customer_reviews.title: Never worked
customer_reviews.text: Not much to it. Plug it in, look for the new drive. New drive never showed up.
customer_reviews.author: Olddreamer

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 4hrs
customer_reviews.text: Received the item. Formatted. Transferred all of files from one hard drive to this new. After 4hrs, blue screen and drive was dead. Returned it. RIP.
customer_reviews.author: Freedmindz

customer_reviews.title: Good value, fast, external storage
customer_reviews.text: I got this to be a backup drive for my photos after I filled up my Seagate driven I wanted one that if I had to move it wouldn't blownup on me. It was a little bit of a pain to install, but once installed its working fast and reliably.
customer_reviews.author: Katharine Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Mystery: Disk has 1 GB on it
customer_reviews.text: Even after formatting. 1.11GB is in use. But by what? Bad sectors?
customer_reviews.author: Y. Leventhal

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE! TURN BACK AND BUY SOMEWHERE ELSE
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product!!! DO NOT PURCHASE!! I plugged it in to back up all my files for my Masters degree. Super slow, didn’t transfer half and now I have a connection error every time I plug it in. Will be throwing this out and purchasing through Apple like I did for my other external drive! Extremely disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: KayKay

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Solid and durable. The connection comes loose a lil too easily but as long as you are careful it's a great and good looking drive.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Platizky

customer_reviews.title: is there larger tb than 4tb in this style
customer_reviews.text: it is a bit hard to plug in but i do like bumper guard around it i have dropped several hard drives. this one should last awhile
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Broken after a few months...
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend this product. I have bought multiple external hard drives in the past and this one has failed. Only have a few months, it is no longer recognizing my computer. I do not recommend these at all!
customer_reviews.author: The Honest Review

customer_reviews.title: Cable included
customer_reviews.text: Includes 12” usbc cable and adapter to usb 2! I was unaware and ordered those separately- hopefully it helps you to know this!
customer_reviews.author: Brian J Muth

customer_reviews.title: The perfect hard drive
customer_reviews.text: I'm a wedding photographer by trade. I absolutely love this hard drive. It's fast, easy to use and portable. Very good price for the size and durability. I will never purchase another western digital or seagate again.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer W.

customer_reviews.title: Very well made, fast and quiet
customer_reviews.text: I have no complaints and I would buy it again. I already had the G Tech 2tb which has been a gem for two years. This one promises to be just as good and I hope it will prove as reliable.
customer_reviews.author: JMF12345

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Just as advertised. Had 2 bad experiences with WD Passport drives - both corrupted and ruined my life for 2 weeks trying to bring them back. Bought a G-Drive instead and it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Goode

customer_reviews.title: Failed two month after purchase
customer_reviews.text: We bought 2 of these hard drive. They were used on Pro Macs. They randomly had trouble mouthing to the computers. Today the second one failed. Don't waste your money. You can purchase a less expensive portable hard drive for a lot less and don't deal with the headaches that come with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Great product so far.
customer_reviews.text: Product is sound, so far. Extremely grateful this is a ruggedized hard drive though. Amazon literally slapped a label on the original packaging and shipped it.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Durable and good value, not as fast as I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Durable and good value, not as fast as I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Sanford S.

customer_reviews.title: Armor makes it pretty large
customer_reviews.text: Solid drive. But beware it’s larger than usual to accommodate the “armor.” I’d only recommend it if you need the extra protection, otherwise get something smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Wizard Island

customer_reviews.title: Did not connect and format to a Mac
customer_reviews.text: Though advertised to work with a Mac, once connected, it would not format and the drive was not recognized.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with this drive
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to serve as my off-site backup drive. Seems rugged and works fine. I especially like the rubber port protector.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Frankel

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: Great hard drive. The cord does slip out easily but you could always replace the cord.
customer_reviews.author: V J

customer_reviews.title: Frustrated
customer_reviews.text: I felt frustrated because when the product arrived it didn't work on my iPhone, only on my Android, and I needed it for my iPhone!
customer_reviews.author: Ribamar Medeiros

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: The external hard disk is for high school students to learn to use. It takes a bit of time to install the notebook, the operation is not very easy, and the price is a bit high. I am considering buying another one for another use!
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: i LIKE IT
customer_reviews.text: Need something portable to handle all my videos and this is working out great.
customer_reviews.author: M. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Product came recommend by professor. My daughter used it for a production class in college.
customer_reviews.author: CARDA

customer_reviews.title: Seems like quality
customer_reviews.text: I have 1 million photos that I save on hard drives. This one’s a fast drive. Hopefully it will hold up.
customer_reviews.author: JonSn

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't show up.
customer_reviews.text: This product doesn't show up on my Mac and I have no way to access it or change my password. I saw on the official website that this issue is persistent and hasn't been corrected since 2016.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Browne

customer_reviews.title: This Drive will Fail
customer_reviews.text: I have used this hard drive for less than three months and it has already failed.
customer_reviews.author: Sabe

customer_reviews.title: Keeping my files safe
customer_reviews.text: Great hard drive. My files aré highly protected!! Love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great deal
customer_reviews.text: not the slimmest but definitely the most sturdy. I love it
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Good product for software development.
customer_reviews.text: I was able to configure a mini server on the hard drive. Very good good product 👍
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Graham

customer_reviews.title: Dead in 1 month
customer_reviews.text: Had the drive for one month. My mac crashed and then it just wouldn't mount....lost all my data. Never dropped. Never had a drive die this quickly. G-Tech used to be reliable...this is just garbage.
customer_reviews.author: pmLA

customer_reviews.title: It's slow to transfer
customer_reviews.text: It took forever to transfer footage. G-Tech has much faster drives that are just as rugged.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 3 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Seemed well built and looked nice. Worked as expected for ~3 weeks but then failed spontaneously just sitting on a desk with very limited activity. Probably just got a bad apple.
customer_reviews.author: Tera Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Dead!
customer_reviews.text: The drive started clicking after about 4 months of use. I'm no longer able to transfer files to or from the drive. Useless.
customer_reviews.author: SquintPics

customer_reviews.title: Built like a tank
customer_reviews.text: Built like a tank. This drive is durable and dependable. I would love it if it was a little faster but it gives me peace of mind if I have to transport large files safely.
customer_reviews.author: Alvin Agarrat

customer_reviews.title: 2TB is enough for this home computer
customer_reviews.text: This unit is very reliable. I use to backup my costly genealogy files. It's a great go anywhere unit.
customer_reviews.author: Edna Old

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good external drive
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful external drive. Really helped me in a tight spot when my 2TB stared corrupting all my data.
customer_reviews.author: Jaylon Moseley

customer_reviews.title: Good external hard drive
customer_reviews.text: Moderate read / write speed for a spinning drive, can not be RAIDed or daisy chained, solid & rugged work / storage mobile drive for the money
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: FAST and DURABLE
customer_reviews.text: Very durable nice to look at. Backwards compatible on Old PCs and very fast on new PCs. Excellent
customer_reviews.author: Phlex

customer_reviews.title: Convenient
customer_reviews.text: I should have buy this earlier. Great gadget to keep safe all family pictures
customer_reviews.author: Alex Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Good value and performance.
customer_reviews.text: Love the capacity of 4TB and the rugged rubber small enough to carry in my laptop bag.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last
customer_reviews.text: Only had the drive for a month ... Used it to backup another external drive... it crashed during a transfer and is completely unresponsive.... I will not be buying from this company again
customer_reviews.author: Keith

product_meta.title: G-Technology 4TB ArmorATD All-Terrain Rugged Portable External Hard Drive - USB-C, Thunderbolt 3, USB 3.0 - 0G10435-1
product_meta.description: Capacity:4TBYou go through extremes to capture the perfect shot, so make sure your storage is as relentless as you are. With G-Technology’s ArmorATD drive, you get an all-terrain drive with shock, rain, dust and crush resistance to protect your footage from out in the wild to back in the studio. Finally, a rugged drive you can rely on. | *As used for storage capacity, one terabyte (TB) = one trillion bytes. Total accessible capacity varies depending on operating environment. | **Shock resistance up to 1.2m for 1TB and 2TB drive, and 1m for 4TB and 5TB drive on a carpeted concrete floor.
feature_bullets: Triple-layer shock resistance for added durability
Rain-and dust-resistant (IP54) enclosure with a 1000lb crush rating
With capacities up to 5TB* of storage for your photos and footage
USB-C ready; USB-3.0 and Thunderbolt 3 compatible
Ready to go with mac and Windows

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars486 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
